datainfo.source: Geometry taken from documents provided on the JET webpages in 2013 and from the program SURF. Toroidal dimensions are taken from a document "A2 antenna dimensions for modelling" by Igor Monakov 2013-04-18. The toroidal location of the four antennas are taken from the [A. Kaye et al, Fusion Engineering and Design 24 (1994) 1-21]. The poloidal shape of the antenna is extracted from the output of the program SURF (2013-03-18). svnURL: https://gforge.efda-itm.eu/svn/imp5tool/trunk/cpogenerators/hcdsystems/IC/GenerateDatabase; svnversion: 434M

antenna_lh.name: Put value here

modules.documentation: Modules description. NB there are nmodules per antenna, distributed among nma_phi toroidal positions and nma_theta poloidal positions

nma_theta.documentation: Number of modules per antenna in the poloidal direction.

nma_phi.documentation: Number of modules per antenna in the toroidal direction.

ima_theta.documentation: Position index of the module in the poloidal direction (from low theta to high theta, i.e. from bottom to top if the antenna is on LFS). Vector of integers (nmodules).

ima_phi.documentation: Position index of the module in the toroidal direction (from low phi to high phi, counter-clockwise when seen from above). Vector of integers (nmodules).

nwm_theta.documentation: Number of waveguides per module in the poloidal direction.

nwm_phi.documentation: Number of waveguides per module in the toroidal direction.

mask.documentation: Mask of passive and active waveguides for an internal module; Vector of integers (nwm_phi)

npwbm_phi.documentation: Number of passive waveguide between modules in the toroidal direction

npwe_phi.documentation: Number of passive waveguides on each antenna edge in the toroidal direction

hw_theta.documentation: Height of waveguides in the poloidal direction [m]

biwp.documentation: Width of internal passive waveguides [m]; Float

bewp.documentation: Width of edge passive waveguides [m]; Float

e_phi.documentation: Thickness between waveguides in the toroidal direction [m], Vector (nthick_phi). Reminder : nthick_phi = nmp_phi*nwm_phi + (nmp_phi - 1)*npwbm_phi + 2*npwe_phi

scl.documentation: Short circuit length for passive waveguides [m], Vector (nshort_phi). Reminder : nshort _phi = nmp_phi* npwm_phi + (nmp_phi - 1)*npwbm_phi + 2*npwe_phi

pivot_point.documentation: Pivot point of each line of sight; Vector (nchords)

horchordang1.documentation: Angle [rad] of horizontal projection of l.o.s. with poloidal cross section (0 for HFS to LFS chord - see Convention_angles_interfdiag.pdf) [rad]. Vector (nchords)

verchordang1.documentation: Angle of chord with vertical axis (0 for bottom-top chord, Pi for top-bottom chord - see Convention_angles_interfdiag.pdf) [rad]; Vector (nchords)

width.documentation: Width of the laser beam (1/e) [m]; Vector (nchords)

second_point.documentation: Second point defining the line of sight together with the pivot_point. In case the probing wave is reflected, this should be the position of the mirror. This data is redundant with horchordang1 and verchordang1. Vector (nchords).

horchordang2.documentation: For reflected l.o.s. only (undefined otherwise) : Angle [rad] of horizontal projection of reflected l.o.s. with poloidal cross section (0 for HFS to LFS chord - see Convention_angles_interfdiag.pdf) [rad]. Vector (nchords)

verchordang2.documentation: For reflected l.o.s. only (undefined otherwise) : Angle of reflected chord with vertical axis (0 for bottom-top chord, Pi for top-bottom chord - see Convention_angles_interfdiag.pdf) [rad]; Vector (nchords)

third_point.documentation: Third point defining the reflected line of sight together with the second_point (undefined if the probing wave is not reflected). This data is redundant with horchordang2 and verchordang2. Vector (nchords).

interfdiag.documentation: Interferometry; measures line-integrated electron density [m^-2]; Time-dependent CPO

datainfo.source: JET Drawing Office (Cliff Marren), see http://w3.ed.jet.efda.org/FIRNS/ITM/ITM_DIAG_KG1_Mirrors.pdf, and http://w3.ed.jet.efda.org/FIRNS/ITM/ITM_DIAG_KG1_Vessel_Coordinates.pdf
datainfo.comment: The laser chord positions given below are for a vessel temperature of 200 C, which is valid for the range of shots between 52888 and 79853 (It is intended to upgrade the diagnostic with a new laser for shots from 79853 onwards). The diagnostic consists of 4 vertical chords (LID 1-4) and 4 lateral chords (LID 5-8). The latter are reflected on mirrors mounted on the inboard wall. The beam width given below is at plasma median (at laser output the laser beam width is 17mm instead).

datainfo.comment: Written by write_Machine_Description.pro with a torus temperature of 200C.Geometry tabulated for PINI 1 only. This can be used only if the other pinis are off, or the voltage difference between pini 1 and the others is >about 50 kV. Data are in private PPFs (mainly under userids nch, mbrix, erach, plotte, rdeang). Contact the diagnostic RO to have public ppfs written.

cocos.documentation: COordinates COnventionS followed by this CPO

id.documentation: CPO id for checking its provenance in the workflow

polarimetry.documentation: This structure accomodates the polarimetry setup and measurements of a mse diagnostic, as widely used in fusion devices. The final measurement is the tan(gamma) where gamma is the polarization angle of a particular spectral mse component.

rzgamma.documentation: Position and width of the intersection between beam and line of sight. Vectors (nchords)

geom_coef.documentation: Geometric coefficients (9) describing the angle between beam and line of sight; The first dimension contains succesively : numerator, coefficients of BZ, BR, Bphi, ER; denominator, coefficients of BZ, BR, Bphi, ER, EZ; Matrix (9,nchords). In versions of the data structure before 4.08, there were only 6 coefficients namely : numerator, coefficients of BZ, BR, Bphi; denominator, coefficients of BZ, BR, Bphi.

spectral.documentation: This structure accommodates the types needed on a spectral MSE diagnostic namely the emmissivity and the radiance spectra. It will be subsequenty upgraded with optical + photon detection elements since the structure will also be used for a synthetic spectral mse code.

radia_chord.documentation: MSE radiance characterization. This structure is used for each line of sight of the MSE setup and contains the geometry of the line of sight, the radiance(wavelength) for each polarization state, the quantization axis. Replicate the structure for each line of sight.

setup.documentation: Geometry for the observation line of sight

pivot_point.documentation: Pivot point of mse line of sight. Scalar

horchordang.documentation: Angle [rad] of horizontal projection of mse line of sight with poloidal cross section (0 for HFS to LFS trajectory - see Convention_angles_interfdiag.pdf) [rad]. Scalar

verchordang.documentation: Angle of mse line of sight with vertical axis (0 for bottom-top trajectory, Pi for top-bottom trajectory - see Convention_angles_interfdiag.pdf) [rad]; Scalar

second_point.documentation: Second point defining the mse line of sight together with the pivot_point. Scalar

nbi.documentation: Neutral Beam Injection. Input to NBI source codes; describes the neutrals that are about to be launched into the torus; Time-dependent CPO

datainfo.source: Original data comes from the 5 column ascii data from ASCOT team for both Oct4 and Oct8 and for the 4 different upshifted setups that each octant can have (UP0, UP17, UP167 and UP1467). A script parsed JET PPF to get the AL1,4,6,7 signals for both octants and assess when new configurations emerge. XML templates for the available configurations of both octants are then pasted in a void XML CPO template according to the shot series
datainfo.comment: Spotted an error on the angle of beamlets (was the same for all units/pinis); Setup featuring OCT4_UP0 and OCT8_UP0

cocos.documentation: COordinates COnventionS followed by this CPO

id.documentation: CPO id for checking its provenance in the workflow

nbi_unit.documentation: Vector of Neutral Beam Injector units. The NBI system should be separated in to the individually power strucutres. Structure array(nunits). Time-dependent

name.documentation: Name of the neutral beam injector

nbi_unit.name: OCT4_PINI1

beamletgroup.documentation: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlet-group provides a fair description.

position.documentation: Position of centre of injection unit surface (or grounded grid).

tang_rad.documentation: Tangency radius (major radius where the central line of a NBI unit is tangent to a circle around the torus) [m]

angle.documentation: Angle of inclination between a line at the centre of the injection unit surface and the horiontal plane [rad]

direction.documentation: Direction of the beam seen from above the torus: -1 = clockwise; 1 = counter clockwise

width_horiz.documentation: Horizontal width of the beam group at the injection unit surface (or grounded grid) [m]

width_vert.documentation: Vertical width of the beam group at the injection unit surface (or grounded grid) [m]

focussing.documentation: Describes how the beam is focussed.

focal_len_hz.documentation: Horizontal focal length along the beam line, i.e. the point along the centre of the beamlet-group where the beamlet-group has its minimum horizontal width [m]. Scalar

focal_len_vc.documentation: Vertical focal length along the beam line, i.e. the point along the centre of the beamlet-group where the beamlet-group has its minimum vertical width [m]. Scalar

width_min_hz.documentation: The horizontal width of the beamlet-group at the at the horizontal focal point [m]. Scalar

width_min_vc.documentation: The vertical width of the beamlet-group at the at the vertical focal point [m]. Scalar

divergence.documentation: Detailed information on beamlet divergence. Divergens is described as a super position of Gaussian profiles with amplitide "frac_divcomp" and vertical/horizontal divergence "div_vert"/"div_horiz". Note that for positive ion NBI the divergence is well described by a single Gaussian.

div_vert.documentation: The vertical beamlet divergence [rad]. Here the divergence is defined for Gaussian beams as the angel where the beam density is reduced by a factor 1/e compared to the maximum density. For non-Gaussian beams the divergence is sqrt(2)*mean((x-mean(x))**2), where x is the angle and the mean should be performed over the beam density, P(x): mean(y)=int(y*P(x)*dx). Vector(ndiv_comp)

div_horiz.documentation: The horizontal beamlet divergence [rad]. Here the divergence is defined for Gaussian beams as the angel where the beam density is reduced by a factor 1/e compared to the maximum density. For non-Gaussian beams the divergence is sqrt(2)*mean((x-mean(x))**2), where x is the angle and the mean should be performed over the beam density, P(x): mean(y)=int(y*P(x)*dx). Vector(ndiv_comp)

position.documentation: Position of beamlets. Vector rzphi1D (nbeamlets)

tang_rad_blt.documentation: Tangency radius (major radius where the central line of a beamlet is tangent to a circle around the torus) [m]; Vector(nbeamlets)

angle_blt.documentation: Angle of inclination between a line at the centre of a beamlet and the horiontal plane [rad]; Vector(nbeamlets)

pow_frc_blt.documentation: Fraction of power of a unit injected by a beamlet; Vector(nbeamlets)

wall.documentation: Description of the wall components in the NBI system that limits the beam spatial width of the beam. The wall is here described a superposition of surface segments and collimating holes.

surface.documentation: A collimating solid surface described by a polygon; no particle can pass through this surface

triangle.documentation: Triangular wall surface described by its three corners: point1, point2, and point3. Vector(n_triangles)

rectangle.documentation: Rectangular wall surface described by its four corners. These form an ordered sequence: point00, point01, point11, point10. Here the first point should be calculated from the other three as point00=point01+poin10-point11. Vector(n_rectangles)

collimator.documentation: Vector of collimating holes (openings). Each hole has to be flat, i.e. it lies on a surface. Particles can only cross this surface by passing through the hole. To describe the hole we first construct a coordinate system on the surface by defining the original and two basis vectors in (x,y,z) space. The polyon is then represented as the origin, plus a linear combination of the two basis vectors using coord1 and coord2. As an example, a rectangle with two of the corners given by "origin+basis1" and "origin+basis2" can be described using coord1=[1,0,-1,0] and coord2=[0,1,0,-1].

origin.documentation: Origin of the surface coordinate system.

basis1.documentation: First basis vector on the surface.

basis2.documentation: First basis vector on the surface.

coord1.documentation: First coordinate of the polygon points, conjugate to basis1.

coord2.documentation: Second coordinate of the polygon points, conjugate to basis2.

nbi_unit.documentation: Vector of Neutral Beam Injector units. The NBI system should be separated in to the individually power strucutres. Structure array(nunits). Time-dependent

name.documentation: Name of the neutral beam injector

nbi_unit.name: OCT4_PINI2

beamletgroup.documentation: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlet-group provides a fair description.

position.documentation: Position of centre of injection unit surface (or grounded grid).

tang_rad.documentation: Tangency radius (major radius where the central line of a NBI unit is tangent to a circle around the torus) [m]

angle.documentation: Angle of inclination between a line at the centre of the injection unit surface and the horiontal plane [rad]

direction.documentation: Direction of the beam seen from above the torus: -1 = clockwise; 1 = counter clockwise

width_horiz.documentation: Horizontal width of the beam group at the injection unit surface (or grounded grid) [m]

width_vert.documentation: Vertical width of the beam group at the injection unit surface (or grounded grid) [m]

focussing.documentation: Describes how the beam is focussed.

focal_len_hz.documentation: Horizontal focal length along the beam line, i.e. the point along the centre of the beamlet-group where the beamlet-group has its minimum horizontal width [m]. Scalar

focal_len_vc.documentation: Vertical focal length along the beam line, i.e. the point along the centre of the beamlet-group where the beamlet-group has its minimum vertical width [m]. Scalar

width_min_hz.documentation: The horizontal width of the beamlet-group at the at the horizontal focal point [m]. Scalar

width_min_vc.documentation: The vertical width of the beamlet-group at the at the vertical focal point [m]. Scalar

divergence.documentation: Detailed information on beamlet divergence. Divergens is described as a super position of Gaussian profiles with amplitide "frac_divcomp" and vertical/horizontal divergence "div_vert"/"div_horiz". Note that for positive ion NBI the divergence is well described by a single Gaussian.

div_vert.documentation: The vertical beamlet divergence [rad]. Here the divergence is defined for Gaussian beams as the angel where the beam density is reduced by a factor 1/e compared to the maximum density. For non-Gaussian beams the divergence is sqrt(2)*mean((x-mean(x))**2), where x is the angle and the mean should be performed over the beam density, P(x): mean(y)=int(y*P(x)*dx). Vector(ndiv_comp)

div_horiz.documentation: The horizontal beamlet divergence [rad]. Here the divergence is defined for Gaussian beams as the angel where the beam density is reduced by a factor 1/e compared to the maximum density. For non-Gaussian beams the divergence is sqrt(2)*mean((x-mean(x))**2), where x is the angle and the mean should be performed over the beam density, P(x): mean(y)=int(y*P(x)*dx). Vector(ndiv_comp)

position.documentation: Position of beamlets. Vector rzphi1D (nbeamlets)

tang_rad_blt.documentation: Tangency radius (major radius where the central line of a beamlet is tangent to a circle around the torus) [m]; Vector(nbeamlets)

angle_blt.documentation: Angle of inclination between a line at the centre of a beamlet and the horiontal plane [rad]; Vector(nbeamlets)

pow_frc_blt.documentation: Fraction of power of a unit injected by a beamlet; Vector(nbeamlets)

wall.documentation: Description of the wall components in the NBI system that limits the beam spatial width of the beam. The wall is here described a superposition of surface segments and collimating holes.

surface.documentation: A collimating solid surface described by a polygon; no particle can pass through this surface

triangle.documentation: Triangular wall surface described by its three corners: point1, point2, and point3. Vector(n_triangles)

rectangle.documentation: Rectangular wall surface described by its four corners. These form an ordered sequence: point00, point01, point11, point10. Here the first point should be calculated from the other three as point00=point01+poin10-point11. Vector(n_rectangles)

collimator.documentation: Vector of collimating holes (openings). Each hole has to be flat, i.e. it lies on a surface. Particles can only cross this surface by passing through the hole. To describe the hole we first construct a coordinate system on the surface by defining the original and two basis vectors in (x,y,z) space. The polyon is then represented as the origin, plus a linear combination of the two basis vectors using coord1 and coord2. As an example, a rectangle with two of the corners given by "origin+basis1" and "origin+basis2" can be described using coord1=[1,0,-1,0] and coord2=[0,1,0,-1].

origin.documentation: Origin of the surface coordinate system.

basis1.documentation: First basis vector on the surface.

basis2.documentation: First basis vector on the surface.

coord1.documentation: First coordinate of the polygon points, conjugate to basis1.

coord2.documentation: Second coordinate of the polygon points, conjugate to basis2.

nbi_unit.documentation: Vector of Neutral Beam Injector units. The NBI system should be separated in to the individually power strucutres. Structure array(nunits). Time-dependent

focal_len_hz.documentation: Horizontal focal length along the beam line, i.e. the point along the centre of the beamlet-group where the beamlet-group has its minimum horizontal width [m]. Scalar

focal_len_vc.documentation: Vertical focal length along the beam line, i.e. the point along the centre of the beamlet-group where the beamlet-group has its minimum vertical width [m]. Scalar

width_min_hz.documentation: The horizontal width of the beamlet-group at the at the horizontal focal point [m]. Scalar

width_min_vc.documentation: The vertical width of the beamlet-group at the at the vertical focal point [m]. Scalar

divergence.documentation: Detailed information on beamlet divergence. Divergens is described as a super position of Gaussian profiles with amplitide "frac_divcomp" and vertical/horizontal divergence "div_vert"/"div_horiz". Note that for positive ion NBI the divergence is well described by a single Gaussian.

div_vert.documentation: The vertical beamlet divergence [rad]. Here the divergence is defined for Gaussian beams as the angel where the beam density is reduced by a factor 1/e compared to the maximum density. For non-Gaussian beams the divergence is sqrt(2)*mean((x-mean(x))**2), where x is the angle and the mean should be performed over the beam density, P(x): mean(y)=int(y*P(x)*dx). Vector(ndiv_comp)

div_horiz.documentation: The horizontal beamlet divergence [rad]. Here the divergence is defined for Gaussian beams as the angel where the beam density is reduced by a factor 1/e compared to the maximum density. For non-Gaussian beams the divergence is sqrt(2)*mean((x-mean(x))**2), where x is the angle and the mean should be performed over the beam density, P(x): mean(y)=int(y*P(x)*dx). Vector(ndiv_comp)

position.documentation: Position of beamlets. Vector rzphi1D (nbeamlets)

tang_rad_blt.documentation: Tangency radius (major radius where the central line of a beamlet is tangent to a circle around the torus) [m]; Vector(nbeamlets)

angle_blt.documentation: Angle of inclination between a line at the centre of a beamlet and the horiontal plane [rad]; Vector(nbeamlets)

pow_frc_blt.documentation: Fraction of power of a unit injected by a beamlet; Vector(nbeamlets)

wall.documentation: Description of the wall components in the NBI system that limits the beam spatial width of the beam. The wall is here described a superposition of surface segments and collimating holes.

surface.documentation: A collimating solid surface described by a polygon; no particle can pass through this surface

triangle.documentation: Triangular wall surface described by its three corners: point1, point2, and point3. Vector(n_triangles)

rectangle.documentation: Rectangular wall surface described by its four corners. These form an ordered sequence: point00, point01, point11, point10. Here the first point should be calculated from the other three as point00=point01+poin10-point11. Vector(n_rectangles)

collimator.documentation: Vector of collimating holes (openings). Each hole has to be flat, i.e. it lies on a surface. Particles can only cross this surface by passing through the hole. To describe the hole we first construct a coordinate system on the surface by defining the original and two basis vectors in (x,y,z) space. The polyon is then represented as the origin, plus a linear combination of the two basis vectors using coord1 and coord2. As an example, a rectangle with two of the corners given by "origin+basis1" and "origin+basis2" can be described using coord1=[1,0,-1,0] and coord2=[0,1,0,-1].

origin.documentation: Origin of the surface coordinate system.

basis1.documentation: First basis vector on the surface.

basis2.documentation: First basis vector on the surface.

coord1.documentation: First coordinate of the polygon points, conjugate to basis1.

coord2.documentation: Second coordinate of the polygon points, conjugate to basis2.

nbi_unit.documentation: Vector of Neutral Beam Injector units. The NBI system should be separated in to the individually power strucutres. Structure array(nunits). Time-dependent

name.documentation: Name of the neutral beam injector

nbi_unit.name: OCT8_PINI1

Note that for positive ion NBI the divergence is well described by a single Gaussian.

div_vert.documentation: The vertical beamlet divergence [rad]. Here the divergence is defined for Gaussian beams as the angel where the beam density is reduced by a factor 1/e compared to the maximum density. For non-Gaussian beams the divergence is sqrt(2)*mean((x-mean(x))**2), where x is the angle and the mean should be performed over the beam density, P(x): mean(y)=int(y*P(x)*dx). Vector(ndiv_comp)

div_horiz.documentation: The horizontal beamlet divergence [rad]. Here the divergence is defined for Gaussian beams as the angel where the beam density is reduced by a factor 1/e compared to the maximum density. For non-Gaussian beams the divergence is sqrt(2)*mean((x-mean(x))**2), where x is the angle and the mean should be performed over the beam density, P(x): mean(y)=int(y*P(x)*dx). Vector(ndiv_comp)

position.documentation: Position of beamlets. Vector rzphi1D (nbeamlets)

tang_rad_blt.documentation: Tangency radius (major radius where the central line of a beamlet is tangent to a circle around the torus) [m]; Vector(nbeamlets)

angle_blt.documentation: Angle of inclination between a line at the centre of a beamlet and the horiontal plane [rad]; Vector(nbeamlets)

pow_frc_blt.documentation: Fraction of power of a unit injected by a beamlet; Vector(nbeamlets)

wall.documentation: Description of the wall components in the NBI system that limits the beam spatial width of the beam. The wall is here described a superposition of surface segments and collimating holes.

surface.documentation: A collimating solid surface described by a polygon; no particle can pass through this surface

triangle.documentation: Triangular wall surface described by its three corners: point1, point2, and point3. Vector(n_triangles)

rectangle.documentation: Rectangular wall surface described by its four corners. These form an ordered sequence: point00, point01, point11, point10. Here the first point should be calculated from the other three as point00=point01+poin10-point11. Vector(n_rectangles)

collimator.documentation: Vector of collimating holes (openings). Each hole has to be flat, i.e. it lies on a surface. Particles can only cross this surface by passing through the hole. To describe the hole we first construct a coordinate system on the surface by defining the original and two basis vectors in (x,y,z) space. The polyon is then represented as the origin, plus a linear combination of the two basis vectors using coord1 and coord2. As an example, a rectangle with two of the corners given by "origin+basis1" and "origin+basis2" can be described using coord1=[1,0,-1,0] and coord2=[0,1,0,-1].

origin.documentation: Origin of the surface coordinate system.

basis1.documentation: First basis vector on the surface.

basis2.documentation: First basis vector on the surface.

coord1.documentation: First coordinate of the polygon points, conjugate to basis1.

coord2.documentation: Second coordinate of the polygon points, conjugate to basis2.

nbi_unit.documentation: Vector of Neutral Beam Injector units. The NBI system should be separated in to the individually power strucutres. Structure array(nunits). Time-dependent

name.documentation: Name of the neutral beam injector

nbi_unit.name: OCT8_PINI7

beamletgroup.documentation: Group of beamlets with common vertical and horizontal focal point. If there are no common focal points, then select small groups of beamlets such that a focal point description of the beamlet-group provides a fair description.

position.documentation: Position of centre of injection unit surface (or grounded grid).

tang_rad.documentation: Tangency radius (major radius where the central line of a NBI unit is tangent to a circle around the torus) [m]

angle.documentation: Angle of inclination between a line at the centre of the injection unit surface and the horiontal plane [rad]

direction.documentation: Direction of the beam seen from above the torus: -1 = clockwise; 1 = counter clockwise

width_horiz.documentation: Horizontal width of the beam group at the injection unit surface (or grounded grid) [m]

width_vert.documentation: Vertical width of the beam group at the injection unit surface (or grounded grid) [m]

focussing.documentation: Describes how the beam is focussed.

focal_len_hz.documentation: Horizontal focal length along the beam line, i.e. the point along the centre of the beamlet-group where the beamlet-group has its minimum horizontal width [m]. Scalar

focal_len_vc.documentation: Vertical focal length along the beam line, i.e. the point along the centre of the beamlet-group where the beamlet-group has its minimum vertical width [m]. Scalar

width_min_vc.documentation: The vertical width of the beamlet-group at the at the vertical focal point [m]. Scalar

id.documentation: CPO id for checking its provenance in the workflow

name.documentation: Name of coil. Array of strings (ncoils)

id.documentation: ID of coil. Array of strings (ncoils)

emax.documentation: Maximum Energy to be dissipated in coils [J]; Vector (ncoils)

nelement.documentation: Number of elements used to describe a coil; Vector (ncoils)

name.documentation: Name of this element. Should be a matrix of strings (ncoils,max_nelements), but not supported by the UAL yet.

id.documentation: ID of this element. Should be a matrix of strings (ncoils,max_nelements), but not supported by the UAL yet.

turnsign.documentation: Sign of turn and fraction of a turn for calculating magnetic field of the Element; Matrix (ncoils,max_nelements)

area.documentation: Surface area of this element [m^2]; Matrix (ncoils,max_nelements)

pfgeometry.documentation: Shape of a PF Coil Element

type.documentation: Type used to describe a coil shape (0 for 'rzcoordinates' or 1 for 'rzdrdz'); Matrix of integers (ncoils,max_nelements)

npoints.documentation: Number of points describing an element (irregular outline rzcoordinates); Matrix (ncoils,max_nelements)

rzdrdz.documentation: 4-vector defining Centre R,Z and full extents dR, dZ [m]; 3D Array (ncoils,max_nelements,4)

name.documentation: Name of coil. Array of strings (nelements)

area.documentation: Surface area of this passive element [m^2]; Vector (nelements)

eta.documentation: Passive element resistivity [Ohm.m]; Vector (nelements)

type.documentation: Type used to describe the shape (0 for 'rzcoordinates' or 1 for 'rzdrdz'); Vector of integers (nelements)

npoints.documentation: Number of points describing an element (irregular outline rzcoordinates); Vector of integers (nelements)

rzdrdz.documentation: 4-vector defining Centre R,Z and full extents dR, dZ [m]; Matrix (nelements,4)

pfcircuits.documentation: Circuits, connected to multiple coils and to multiple supplies, defining the current and voltage relationships in the system

name.documentation: Name of circuit, array of strings (ncircuits)

pfcircuits.name: Put value here

id.documentation: ID of circuit, array of strings (ncircuits)

type.documentation: Type of circuit, array of strings (ncircuits)

nnodes.documentation: Number of nodes used to describe a circuit. Vector (ncircuits)

connections.documentation: Description of the supplies and coils connections (nodes) across each circuit. Array 3D (ncircuits,max_nnodes,2*ncomponents), describing for each node which component are connected to it (1 if connected, 0 otherwise). There are 2 sides at each component, thus 2*ncomponents as the size of the third dimension, listing first all supplies, then all coils (in the same order as listed in PFSUPPLIES and PFCOILS). An example can be found in the data structure documentation PFconnections.pdf

name.documentation: Name of the supply; Array of strings (nsupplies)

id.documentation: ID of the supply; Array of strings (nsupplies)

type.documentation: Type of supply; Array of strings (nsupplies)

delay.documentation: Pure delay in the supply [s]; Vector (nsupplies)

num.documentation: Coefficients of the numerator, in increasing order : a0 + a1*s + ... + an*s^n; Matrix (nsupplies,n)

den.documentation: Coefficients of the denominator, in increasing order : b0 + b1*s + ... + bm*s^m; Matrix (nsupplies,m)

emax.documentation: Maximum Energy to be dissipated in supply [J]; Vector (nsupplies)

polardiag.documentation: Polarimetry; measures polarisation angle [rad]. Time-dependent CPO

datainfo.source: JET Drawing Office (Cliff Marren), see http://w3.ed.jet.efda.org/FIRNS/ITM/ITM_DIAG_KG1_Mirrors.pdf, and http://w3.ed.jet.efda.org/FIRNS/ITM/ITM_DIAG_KG1_Vessel_Coordinates.pdf
datainfo.comment: The laser chord positions given below are for a vessel temperature of 200 C, which is valid for the range of shots between 52888 and 79853 (It is intended to upgrade the diagnostic with a new laser for shots from 79853 onwards). The diagnostic consists of 4 vertical chords (LID 1-4) and 4 lateral chords (LID 5-8). The latter are reflected on mirrors mounted on the inboard wall. The beam width given below is at plasma median (at laser output the laser beam width is 17mm instead).

cocos.documentation: COordinates COnventionS followed by this CPO

id.documentation: CPO id for checking its provenance in the workflow

expression.documentation: Formal expression for the line integral to be evaluated as a function of ne, ni, Te, Ti, Zeff, Br, Bz

polardiag.expression: Faraday Angle = int(ne B|| dl), where B|| = Btor|| + Bpol|| + Br||, and || means parallel w.r.t. the propagation direction of the laser beam.

setup_line.documentation: Geometric description of the lines of sight

pivot_point.documentation: Pivot point of each line of sight; Vector (nchords)

horchordang1.documentation: Angle [rad] of horizontal projection of l.o.s. with poloidal cross section (0 for HFS to LFS chord - see Convention_angles_interfdiag.pdf) [rad]. Vector (nchords)

verchordang1.documentation: Angle of chord with vertical axis (0 for bottom-top chord, Pi for top-bottom chord - see Convention_angles_interfdiag.pdf) [rad]; Vector (nchords)

width.documentation: Width of the laser beam (1/e) [m]; Vector (nchords)

second_point.documentation: Second point defining the line of sight together with the pivot_point. In case the probing wave is reflected, this should be the position of the mirror. This data is redundant with horchordang1 and verchordang1. Vector (nchords).

horchordang2.documentation: For reflected l.o.s. only (undefined otherwise) : Angle [rad] of horizontal projection of reflected l.o.s. with poloidal cross section (0 for HFS to LFS chord - see Convention_angles_interfdiag.pdf) [rad]. Vector (nchords)

verchordang2.documentation: For reflected l.o.s. only (undefined otherwise) : Angle of reflected chord with vertical axis (0 for bottom-top chord, Pi for top-bottom chord - see Convention_angles_interfdiag.pdf) [rad]; Vector (nchords)

third_point.documentation: Third point defining the reflected line of sight together with the second_point (undefined if the probing wave is not reflected). This data is redundant with horchordang2 and verchordang2. Vector (nchords).

r0.documentation: Characteristic major radius of the device (used in publications, usually middle of the vessel at the equatorial midplane) [m]. Scalar.

datainfo.comment: ILW WALL; Third version: the limiter for ILW comes directly from PPCC (D. Valvarcel and G. Artaserse) ;Second version : the limiter contour for the ILW is obtained from SURF. The number of points differs from the 137 locus of first wall model points as shown in S.Gerasimov data (http://users.jet.efda.org/pages/mags/jet-model/model3d-index.html); it gathers the info from the limiter and vessel CPOs but the vessel part here is more detailed than the vessel CPO and should be used. There is also a block like description for the vessel elaborated by S.Gerasimov. The vessel resistivity is given at 204deg. Permeability taken from http://www.isolthermics.com.au/metals/pdfs/common-tech/Nicrofer%207216%20LC%20-%20alloy%20600L.pdf

id.documentation: CPO id for checking its provenance in the workflow

wall2d_mhd.documentation: Simplified wall that encloses necessary information for RWM codes.

walltype.documentation: Tag the type of wall to be used, 0 (conformal) or 1 (free)

id.documentation: Short string identifier

eta.documentation: Wall resistivity [ohm.m]; Scalar

npoloidal.documentation: Number of poloidal coordinates for each wall (dimension of R and Z);

position.documentation: RZ description of the wall; wall coordinates are defined at a middle line (line passing through the middle of the real wall as defined by thickness parameter delta)

holes.documentation: Structure to describe the placing and properties of the holes

n_holes.documentation: Number of holes on each wall;

coordinates.documentation: Poloidal and Toroidal coordinates of the center of each hole;

theta.documentation: Theta coordinate of holes center; Vector (n_holes)

phi.documentation: Toroidal coordinate of holes center; Vector (n_holes)

width.documentation: Angular width of each in the poloidal and toroidal direction;

eta.documentation: Resistivity of each hole [ohm.m]; Vector (n_holes)

walltype.documentation: Tag the type of wall to be used, 0 (conformal) or 1 (free)

id.documentation: Short string identifier

position.documentation: RZ description of the wall;

wall2d.documentation: 2D wall descriptions; Array of structures (number of wall descriptions). Replicate this element for each type of possible physics or engineering configurations necessary (gas tight vs wall with ports and holes, coarse vs fine representation, single contour limiter, disjoint gapped plasma facing components, ...). Time-dependent

limiter.documentation: Description of the immobile limiting surface(s) or plasma facing components for defining the Last Closed Flux Surface.

limiter_unit.documentation: Vector of limiting surfaces. Replicate this limiter_unit element ncomponents times. Each unit contains a plasma facing component that can have dedicated number of points. Array of structures (ncomponents)

name.documentation: Name or description of the limiter_unit

limiter_unit.name: contour

closed.documentation: Identify whether the contour is closed (y) or open (n)

position.documentation: Position (R,Z coordinates) of a limiting surface. No need to repeat first point for closed contours [m]; Vector(npoints)

eta.documentation: Wall resistivity [ohm.m]; Scalar

delta.documentation: Wall thickness [m] (Optional if a closed facing component is given but useful for simpler closed contour limiter); Scalar

vessel.documentation: Mechanical structure of the vacuum vessel. Vessel assumed as set of nested layers with given physics properties; Two representations are admitted for each vessel unit : annular (two contours) or blocks. The vessel_id identifies the type of vessel_unit set one is using and code-specific representations derived from the official ones are also allowed if documented. Array of structures (nvessel_type)

vessel_id.documentation: Use this identifier to tag the type of vessel you are using. Use flag=0 for the official single/multiple annular vessel and 1 for the official block element representation for each vessel unit. Additional representations needed on a code-by-code basis follow same incremental pair tagging starting on flag=2

id.documentation: Short string identifier

vessel_id.description: Single limiter PFC and the vessel. The first and last points of elements are not coincident

vessel_unit.documentation: Array of vacuum vessel units. Replicate this vessel_unit element ncomponents times. Each unit contains a mechanical structure of the vessel with distinct physics properties. Array of structures (ncomponents)

annular.documentation: Annular representation of a vessel layer by two free-hand contours.

name.documentation: Name or description of the vessel_unit

annular.name: inner_vessel

inside.documentation: Inner Vessel wall outline (list of R,Z co-ordinates) [m]; Vector (npoints_inner)

outside.documentation: Outer Vessel wall outline (list of R,Z co-ordinates) [m]; Vector (npoints_outer)

eta.documentation: Vessel resistivity [ohm.m]; Scalar

blocks.documentation: Block element representation of vessel units. Each vessel unit is decomposed in elementary small units (blocks) caracyerized by a position, resistivity and relative permeability.

blocks_unit.documentation: Vector of blocks that build of the vessel layer. Replicate this element nblocks times. Each unit contains a building block of the vessel and can have dedicated number of points. Array of structures (nblocks)

name.documentation: Name or description of the blocks_unit

blocks_unit.name: Put value here

blocks_unit.name: Put value here

position.documentation: Position (R,Z coordinates) of a vessel segment. No need to repeat first point for closed contours [m]; Vector(npoints)

eta.documentation: Resistivity of the vessel segment [ohm.m]; Scalar

wall3d.documentation: 3D wall descriptions; Array of structures (number of wall descriptions). Replicate this element for each type of possible physics or engineering configurations necessary (gas tight vs wall with ports and holes, coarse vs fine representation, ...). Time-dependent

wall_id.documentation: Identify the type of wall - 0 for gas tight and 1 for a wall with holes/open ports

id.documentation: Short string identifier
